1.content:
You walk into the large, medical style building, in disbelief of the advertisements they had been running. They claim they can not only safely remove one's brain, but put it into another body as well! As the automated sliding doors open, you are greeted by a receptionist.
"Hello! Welcome to the Brain Center! Please fill out this basic information sheet before we begin so that we may better serve you!" A friendly cat-girl smiles. "Or, if you have any questions, I'd be happy to help you out"
1.title: Welcome to the Brain Center!

11.content:
You decide that you know all you need to know about the place, and fill in the basic information, basically asking who you are.


The first question is what species are you?
11.title: Fill out the sheet

111.content: You cross 'human' as your species. That was an easy one. The next one asks if you're male or a female.
111.title: Human

1111.content:
This is an easy question, of course you are male. You have the package to proof it.

The third question is what you are doing here.

You can choose between:

A) A brain transplant. This just means transplanting your brain into somebody else their body.

B) A brain removal. This means that your brain is removed and placed into a jar. What happens after that, is up to you.

C) A custom job. The brain center offers different services, ranging from tweaking with your IQ to fusing brains with each other.
1111.title: A male.

11111.content:
"Well, that's easy I'm here for a full transplant..." You mumble to yourself and mark the box, it's only natural to feel a little curious about what possibilities of entertainment you can have having your brain put into something, someone, or maybe even held up in storage in case you feel like going back to the other options on the list.

But now comes the next part, what you actually want your brain to be put into in the first place...
11111.title: A) Brain transplant

111111.content:
You go down the list a bit to make sure of what options you had, sure slipping into an anthro or hybrid like the receptionist girl would be interesting or what it would be like to slip into a cyborg or something of the sort going of the other boxes to check off. However, the idea of sticking to a human body is comforting to say the least since it's something you're familiar enough with to know how to use but also strange enough to have some level of adventure.

You flip the page with it's disclaimer and legal obligation talks to move onto what types of bodies there is or is available to you to much of your own knowledge.
111111.title: A Human

1112.content:
This is an easy question, of course you are female. You have the boobs to proof it.

The third question is what you are doing here.

You can choose between:

A) A brain transplant. This just means transplanting your brain into somebody else their body.

B) A brain removal. This means that your brain is removed and placed into a jar. What happens after that, is up to you.

C) A custom job. The brain center offers different services, ranging from tweaking with your IQ to fusing brains with each other.
1112.title: A female.

11121.content:
You are here for a brain transplant. It always has been one of your dreams to have your brain being transplanted. The next question is being left opened. It's here that you can tell where your brain will end up.

You fill in...
11121.title: A brain transplant.

111211.content:
You choose for the safest thing, a human being. From what you could gather the Brain Center is renowned for their Brain transplants with human beings. Of course only with some people.

The next question is what kind of human being?
111211.title: a human being

choices: An uncle, aunt or other relative.
1112111.content:
Since this is your first transplant, you want to keep it simple and safe. It will be a family member. No dealings with friends or with strangers.

Of course the next question is who the family member is.

As you write it, you're surprised by the paper you are writing on. Every time you give an answer, the question and your answer disappears and the next question appears. It's cool.

You write the name of...
1112111.title: A familymember.

11121111.content: One of your parents is paying for this brain transplant, so they want to swap with you alone. You write the name of your...
11121111.title: one of your parents

111211112.content: It's your mother of course, who else? But is it your real mother or your stepmother?
111211112.title: (step)mother.

1112111122.content: It's your stepmother of course. But what kind of a stepmother is she?
1112111122.title: Your stepmother.

choices: Yes, she has one or more.
11121111221.content: Your stepmother is the kind and gentle one to your surprise. After your real mother disappeared (for reasons unknown to anyone) your father met your stepmother. Unlike the usual stepmother she actually wasn't stuck up or really hot like usual, she was a normal woman who lost her husband and was searching for companionship. Did she have kids of her own?
11121111221.title: Kind and gentle one.

111211112211.content:
Your stepmother didn't have any kids of her own, though she did want to have kids. That's why she cherished trying being your mother. Though lacking the experience did cause some nasty moments. Nevertheless she always did her best for you and as a present you offered to swap brains to thank her for her help. She refused at first of course, but you pointed out that she could learn more about you while you would learn more about her. In the end she accepted your offer.

That doesn't tell what kind of girl you are. How would you describe yourself?
111211112211.title: No, she has none.

choices: Tell tell dad and your boyfriend. Things will get awkward if they dont know.
No secrets. you don't want to hide this.
1112111122111.content:
In all honesty, a you're bit on the unremarkable side. Not tall, but not short either, Long hair, grayish blue eyes, average cup size, just the slightest hints of a tan starting to form, enough to not look pale but not enough to be readily noticeable, not in the best of shape but not overweight, rather plain sense of fashion... the only traits that really stick out are your bright red hair, and insistence on wearing glasses rather than contacts (you've always insisted that they itch) otherwise you would blend unnoticably into almost any crowd.

Maybe this will give you a chance to shed that 'boring girl' description that you seemed to pick up during your last year of highschool? You hope so, since that has secretly been part of your motivation for doing this. even if it does make you feel a little guilty...

Regardless, the forms are done and it's time to head inside.

after a brief wait, you're brought inside one of the preparation rooms. There's a nurse waiting for you, she wastes about twenty minutes going over and repeating what you have already agreed to, and signed, before handing you a medical gown and gesturing to a privacy screen set up on one side on the room. It doesn't take long to change. Asking if you're going to be sedated now, you get a surprising response.

"Actually, in order to test the spinal nerves, and make sure they're bonding correctly, you can't be fully sedated. We can use local anesthetics to mitigate any pain, but not to a degree that would effect behavior or slow responses" The nurse explained, trying to look as comforting as he could, but you had to admit, that part... well, you weren't sure if you were more nervous or excited by the idea of being awake for the whole thing. "If you're having second thoughts..."

"No. I want to do this." Your answer was firm, if a touch annoyed at being asked that, again. With how they kept doing that, when you know your step mom had been admitted in half the time, you're starting to wonder if you're their first teenage patient or something. Nineteen is still a legal adult in this part of the world though, so you wish they would cut it out already.

Dropping the subject, she has you follow her to another room, and lie down on a special bed there. You can see another bed opposite it as you aproach, arranged so the head of each face each other. You'd recognize the patient lying on it anywhere, even with her skull open to the air. Your step mother with a visible brain actually looks kinda neat.

Once you're laying down, the nurses strap you in place, one of them explaining that patients sometimes spasm when extracted, and they don't want you to hurt yourself. Once you're secure one of the nurses gets out clippers and trims your hairline back about an inch, so that the cuts will be concealed by it growing back in afterwards. Next comes the needles jabbing into your skull. it's kind of like the ones they use before pulling a tooth, the first few hurt, but as they continue the half numb half cold feeling seems to spread fast enough that you don't notice the rest. Pretty soon the entire top of your head is numb.

The first cut is along the shaved strip, slowly and methodically going from behind one ear, to the other. its strange, watching the doctors work via reflections. Seeing them peel back your scalp and fold it neatly inside out against the sterile pad the just put under your head. A part of you insists you should feel scared, but instead you're just excited. This is actually happening. Then your vision gets blocked by your forehead getting folded down over your eyes.

Huh... Your eyebrows look weird upside down and tinted red by the light filtering through the skin behind them.

There's a tugging sensation you can numbly half-feel slowly making a circle around your head where the skin and muscle have been peeled back. In some distant way you know that should probably hurt, but it just feels odd instead. The tugging sensation is gone now, and the top of your head doesn't feel numb any more. It doesn't feel like anything. After that you hear someone say that both patients are ready for 'stage two', and a moment later your senses start cutting out one after another. First hearing, then sight, smell, touch, all of the secondary senses, then large chunks of your body seem to go numb and fade away one after another.

Soon there is only your thoughts. It would be alarming but you expected this. It's actually quite calm. Peaceful.
It is so bizarre being fully awake yet completely unaware of the world.
I'm probably just a brain now. you think to yourself.
Part of you can't help but wonder if there's a way to make this a regular thing, it's really relaxing.

You'll probably be like this for a while. the info pamphlet said something about an 8 hour recovery period for the grafted brain to bond to it's new body... you had assumed you would be asleep or off in some sedative induced la-la-land for that part, but it seems not...

while you have time to think though, something you hadn't put much consideration into comes to mind... who should you tell about this after it's done?
1112111122111.title: A plain average girl.

1112111122112.content: Are you perhaps the nerdy kind of girl? The one that rather reads and is interested in science fiction rather than the latest gossips?
1112111122112.title: Another type of girl.

11121111221121.content:
If you had to be true to yourself, you'd rather describe yourself as a nerdy kind of girl. Your chestnut hair is at shoulder length, always in the same style. That's kind of convenient since the hairdresser always knew what you wanted and you didn't have to talk to her all the time and instead read your comics. You wear glasses, the big ones, since those were the cheapest. Your breasts were kind of average; you didn't think much of them. After all you wear baggy clothes most of the times, jeans and sweaters that always looked too big on your petite frame. But who cares about things like that? You had a best friend after all, Abby and she was a nerd like yourself. Most afternoons you ended up in one of your rooms reading comics and discussing the latest episodes of GoT.

Your stepmother however didn't understand your life and you didn't understand hers either. That's why you suggested this brain transplant, a perfect opportunity since you were curious how it would be switching brains. Your stepmother agreed immediately and the appointment was set up. You filled the form in and hand it back to the receptionist. She looked through it and then pointed you to a room where you needed to go in.

Inside the room a female doctor, her black hair in a strict bun, was standing. She explained you needed to undress yourself and put on the hospital gown after which the procedure would get started. You simply nod your head as the doctor leaves you to get undressed. With a deep breath you pulled off the thick sweater you were wearing together with the loose jeans. The plain white bra and the panties had to go as well. Looking down at your body you realize it would be a while before you would see it again and feel it of course. You quickly pull on the hospital gown after which the doctor came back. She explained the procedure would involve..
11121111221121.title: The nerdy kind of girl.

choices: A select few/ everyone will know about it.
Nobody will know about this. It will be you and your step-mother's secret.
111211112211211.content:
The procedure was as simple as it was elegant. The doctors would cut open your head with a special laser, disconnect your brain from your body, doing the same thing with your stepmother and then connect everything together. The only downside was that the procedure would take a few hours. You just nod your head as you are dying to see this thing through.

The doctor then told you to lie on the stretcher they prepared for you. You lie down on it and as you are wondering what would happen next you feel the sharp point of a needle in your arm. "Sorry." The doctor excuses herself. "We just need to inject you with this special formula we created. It's not like you are being anesthetized but something similar to it.

"What, what will happen?" You ask her curious. The doctor then looks around like she shouldn't tell you. "The formula we created will allow the connections your brain makes to your body be, how should I put it? disconnected. Of course we need to replace all bodily functions with machines and that's why we need to hurry up to the operation room." The doctor nods to you as she moves the stretcher with you on it away to the operating room.

The strangest is that the formula sounds like nonsense to you, but you are feeling it's effects slowly. Already you can't feel your feet anymore. You hope that it will be over soon. Being pulled into the operating room you can see another stretcher already be there; probably your stepmother lying on it. The doctors turn you around making you and your stepmother's heads close to one another. Without anyone saying anything you feel a mask being put on you. Gas enters through the mask and you can't help but breath the gas in. You try to stay awake, this is a once in a lifetime opportunity, but you feel dizzy and fall asleep.

The next thing you know, you are somewhere else. You feel different somehow; like someone has cut off all your limbs and your floating somehow without the need to breath. You can remember that the doctor told you about that your brains were supposed to be placed inside a jar. To make sure your brains got enough nutrients to make the jump into another body.

The thought about being just a brain inside a jar gives you a feeling of joy, were it not that you couldn't do anything or see anything. The only thing you could do was think. This sucks. You couldn't wait for the transplant to happen. Being placed inside your stepmother's body. What a joy it would be compared to this. That said, will anyone know about the transplant.
111211112211211.title: open head surgery.

1112111122112112.content:
The brain transplant was done under one condition both you and your stepmother agreed on; that nobody knows about the transplant. Not your friends nor your family. You both have to pretend to be the other person so that you really can experience the other's life. It was one of the things you both agreed on. Your father and your best friend both thought that you and your stepmother are on vacation, to strengthen the bond, at least that's the lie you both told them. As the procedure takes the whole week you needed a valid excuse not to make them suspicious.

As you're thinking this whole thing through you suddenly feel some sort of trembling. It's hard to feel being only a brain but it feels like you, or rather brain, is being shaken while being inside the jar. It probably means that your brain is charged with enough nutrients to survive the jump into your stepmother's brain.

Without a notice you suddenly feel something grabbing hold of you. It tries to hold firm but gently as not to damage your brain. The person raises you out of the jar as you no longer can feel the water you were gently floating in. It's an experience of itself and you hope you can do it sometime again. But not for now, now you were going to be transplanted into your new body.

The doctor's put you into your stepmother's open skull. As you're curious to know what the next thing is, you feel yourself being covered in some kind of substance. It's then that you suddenly feel amazing, fantastic even! Like you could spread yourself all around. And surprisingly that feeling becomes reality as you develop little nerves trying to connect with your stepmother's body. As time passes you can feel yourself spreading around even faster. And as the last nerve gets connected a rumbling sensation occurs in your brain knocking you out. The doctors who are in charge of operation know the operation is a success and you and your stepmother are returned to private rooms.

But before continuing how does your stepmother look? Is she small but full-figured or is average length and skinny?
1112111122112112.title: Nobody will know about this. It will be you and...

choices: You go to the bathroom to check yourself out.
Your mother inside your body enters the room.
A doctor with his nurse enter the room.
11121111221121121.content:
Your stepmother is small, even smaller than you, But she makes up for her size with her charming personality and her body. For as she is small she is rather voluptuous. Something you wouldn't mind being for once instead. She has long curly brown hair that rests on her shoulders, her face like her figure is rather big, showing off her double chin. She can't help it though as eating is one of her favorite hobbies. That's why she's always cooking in the kitchen, trying to get you to eat some more as well. Sadly you have to pass as you are lactose intolerant. A pleasant thought occurs that while in your stepmother's body you can finally get to eat one of her cakes. And with that thought in mind you suddenly fall asleep as your brain finds itself hooked to your stepmother's body.

When you wake up your eyes open wide as you look around you. It looks like some hospital room, the white walls, the linoleum floor and of course that familiar odor that hospitals always carried with them. It's then that you realize you can see everything again, you're no longer a brain in a jar. You're in a body again. At least that's how it feels. You can feel your fingers touching the sheets covering you, your feet resting on the mattress, your hair lying on your shoulder. With that observation it should be that you were now in your stepmother's body. But was it really true? There would be only one way to find it out.
11121111221121121.title: Small but full-figured.

111211112211211211.content:
You feel excited as you pull off the sheets. This would be the perfect moment to check yourself out; to see if this thing really worked. You move yourself sidewards and slide off the bed. The moment your feet touch the ground you can already feel it's different; it's like your feet have been programmed different. While you usually tend to put your feet completely on the ground, you now automatically put your toes down first and then the rest of your feet.

Remarkable. You think as you look at the wall in front of you. Then again, it's not the only different thing. The rest of your upper body feels different as well. It's like someone has shoved down a whole pile of pillows down your throat. You feel so large. But you try not to think about it until you have checked yourself out. You step gently on the ground, the moment you do you feel yourself being pulled forward.

"Wow, easy there." You tell yourself. Even your voice sounds different. Neat! You then quickly make your way to the bathroom feeling your behind gently jiggling. She's not only top heavy, but down below she has a jiggly ass as well.
Opening the door and stepping inside you take a deep breath of air as you prepare yourself mentally. This is even way more exciting than the last episode of GOT. Stepping in front of the mirror you see your stepmother's surprised look looking back at you.

"This is real." You tell yourself as you step closer to look at your reflection. There it is, your stepmother's face. Her chubby cheeks, her shiny brown eyes which look a bit dull at the moment. Her long curly hair is all messed up but you don't pay much attention to it, you never found your hair that important at all. You're only missing the light amount of make-up. Some mascara and red lipstick.

Then you take a look down. Your stepmother's body; you swallow hard as this is something you were hoping for. You were always so thin like a stick, but now you feel like a real woman. You see the large breasts sticking out from underneath the hospital gown; the rolls of fat that cling to your gut; though you were surprised by your stepmother's legs. There were sturdy, but not fat or anything like that. Though they are larger than your own. Turning around and looking back you can see the ass you have now. It looks big and doughy. Exactly as you would want it to be.

It's then at that moment that a thought occurs to you; should you try to check things out further? Or would it be too awkward and be something better for at home?
111211112211211211.title: You go to the bathroom to check yourself out.

11121112.content: Is it a male sibling or a female sibling you're going to transplant brains with?

You wake up and look over and see you mum sat there looking at you, she smiled and said how are you feeling Alex? I'm fine I feel ok I guess.

You look down and see you in your Kelly's body your twin brother, you look at your mum and say so does this mean Kelly is in my body now mum.

Yes darling, your the brother and he's the sister in our family now.

Mum look I'm sorry but well I'm straight so I still like boys so it will mean you'll have a gay sim, she smiled and said I don't care darling I love you no matter what Infact you could wear your old clothing and I wouldn't care as long as you improve your brother grades at school.

A female sibling of course. You wouldn't want your first brain transplant to be with a male, yet.

11121112211.content:
Your sister is the bubbly, bimbo type of girl. She has an amazing hot body (you have to admit that yourself). Long blond curly hair, DD-cup breasts and a wasp figure a model would be jealous of. Not only that but she has the cutest boyfriends and the most fun girlfriends to hang around with.

That is why you have asked her to swap brains, letting her stay in your body and you in hers. But what kind of girl are you yourself?
11121112211.title: The bubbly, bimbo type of girl.

111211122112.content:
You yourself are admittedly pretty run-of-the-mill. You have shoulder height brown straight hair, B cups, and a textbook average body. You've never really gotten that much attention from boys, but other girls love your presence.

Finally, the sheet asks for preferred method of brain swapping.
111211122112.title: A normal kind of girl.

1112111221121.content:
You decide to go with the classic way of it. Tried and true!

You hand the information sheet back to the receptionist. She smiles as she grabs it and eyes it over quickly.

"Both of you, please come this way." She says, as she presses a button to open a steel door next to you. You and your older sister stand up and move through the halls, noticing rooms where brains are being removed and swapped. Finally, you reach a room near the end of the hallway. The receptionist opens the door and you both step in.

"The swapper will be with you shortly. If you could both be seated in those two chairs, that would be great." She says, pointing towards two leather chairs in the center of the room. You and your bimbo sister take your seats.

You and your sister chat eagerly about the procedure while you wait. Finally, a tall middle-aged woman steps into the room.

"Are you two ready?" She asks.
1112111221121.title: Head Opening

1112111221122.content:
You decide to go with the new, experimental method.

You hand the information sheet back to the receptionist. She smiles as she grabs it and eyes it over quickly.

"Both of you, please come this way." She says, as she presses a button to open a steel door next to you. You and your older sister stand up and move through the halls, noticing rooms where brains are being removed and swapped. Finally, you reach a room near the end of the hallway. The receptionist opens the door and you both step in.

The strange metallic room contains two seats, with tubes dangling from the ceiling next to them.

"Please take a seat. This procedure doesn't last long. Are you ready?" She asks.
1112111221122.title: Sucked Through Ear

11121112211221.content:
"Great!" She says, with beaming enthusiasm.She walks over to the tube next to you and grabs it by the end. She parts your hair, and begins to slowly insert it.

"This may feel a little weird..." She says, as she sinks the tube deeper into your head. Finally, she stops. She moves over and does the same to your sister.

"We need to lube up your brains... as they will be sliding out of your ears. This will just take a moment." She flips a switch, and strange liquid flows through the tube and into your brain. You find it harder to focus as your brain is drenched in the liquid.

"You might feel dizzy, but that's just temporary. Now you're ready!" She tells you. She puts her finger over a large red switch on the other side of the room. She presses down on it, and you feel a hard suctioning in you ear. Your face contorts into a cringe as you can feel your brain being pushed through your ear. You can see it beginning to emerge from your ear, until everything goes black.
11121112211221.title: Yes!

choices: Intervene, and tell her to be careful?
111211122112211.content:
You wake up with an extreme headache. Something feels... off. You look down at your hands and realize those are most definitely not your hands. You notice long, flowing blonde hair running down your body and bulging tits on your chest.

Holy shit. It worked.

You quickly look over to your former body. Your sister is now playing with once was what your boobs. The receptionist is nowhere to be found, but a note in your lap reads:

Enjoy your new body! Please remain seated while your brain is rewiring itself for your new body, as moving too much may cause potential damage.

With that in mind, you look over to your sister, who is standing up. Should you...
111211122112211.title: ...What happened?

1112111221122111.content:
You're not sure what kind of damage will happen, but you don't want to find out. So you tell your sister to sit down quickly.

"Oops, sorry." She says with that irritating giggle of hers; you roll your eyes as it doesn't sound right with your old body saying it.

So you both sit down for a while. At first you're doubting what the receptionist said was true, but you get these little shocks inside your head. Like your brain connects itself to your sister's body.

It's at that moment you suddenly see a green light glowing above you. It must be the rewiring process being finished.

"I think it's done." You tell your sister.

"Finally, I was, like, so bored." Your sister tells you with an annoyed expression on your former face. She stands up with ease. You however have to walk with your sister's high heels. Only wearing high heels on special occasions they prove quite a challenge. Not to mention your breasts which are more affected by the gravity pulling you over.

"Not so easy right." Your sister tells you as she walks easily on the sandals you wore before.

"I'm getting there." You say grinding through your teeth as you try to take more steps. After a few more minutes you finally get the hang of it. Your sister then takes you by your arm and pulls you outside. At the reception you see some guys sitting there and when you turn up all their eyes turn to you, resting on your body. You feel yourself getting warm by the thought these guys now want to, while before they wouldn't even look at you. Your sister notices the attention and quickly drags you outside.
1112111221122111.title: Intervene, and tell her to be careful?

11121113.content: It's not someone of your immediate family, but someone else. Who could it be?

After that she dated guys a little older, but she once told you she wouldn't mind dating someone in their twenties again.

But what kind of girl are you?

choices: Wishing you good luck with the transplant (they know about it).

Thinking back, you remember seeing a number on the back of the receptionist's jar, since her brain is missing it might make her body connect to yours... is it worth a shot?
12332221111.title: ...That you want to maintain a remote connectio...

123322211111.content:
Selecting the option the machine proceeds to modify your brain so you can remotely control your body. The machine then places your brain in high tech looking box. After the machine is done the booth opens up and you see the cat girl looking up into the air with empty eyes. But you are really curious about the brain to brain communication, leaving the cat girl where she is you move to the reception desk you found the reception brain jar you found a set of numbers.

Frequency Number: 917502592

After finding the frequency number you hit a road block, how the hell do you walking back to the booths you notice something on the reception computer.

Experimental Remote Control Box

Status: Online

Brain: Connected

Frequencies: 0

Please Type Frequent Number here

Ok, with nothing else to do you type in the frequency number in.

Frequency Accepted, do you want switch you your new body?

Yes/No

Noticing nothing else you clicked on yes.

Switching to new body, putting current body to sleep mode. Enjoy your day.

Thus you blackout.

After waking up you notice your no longer in the reception area and back where the booths are. Getting up you immediately notice your no longer in your body. Your smaller, you have breasts, your wearing the reception's uniform, and you have cat ears. Your the reception.

What do you do now?
123322211111.title: Yes, take over her body.

choices: She is quite pissed off at you
She forgives you, it seems she enjoyed her time as a literal airhead
123322211112.content:
deciding to leave the rest of the options at their defaults, you let the system finish up with you.

As it works you black out for a moment, but when your senses clear up, your head feels lighter. reaching up you can feel a faint seam that pops open if pressed. Pushing it open you reach inside your own head, it feels clean and dry inside, being entirely empty. You really did it.

Hinging your now empty head closed and getting up from the chair the first thing you might notice that the receptionist has wandered off. before you can wonder where, you feel an odd pressure in your head, and your senses feel like they're going nuts...

it is suddenly very clear where the receptionist went.

Following the track along the ceiling that the brain extractor runs on, you locate her quickly enough, though your garbled motor control and unreliable senses are making it hard to catch up to her, as she bites another chunk out of your brain, gleefully chewing on her snack.

"Not fair... Mine..." Is all you can manage to say, as you struggle towards her, trying to liberate your now half-eaten brain. The most coherent complaint you can seem to manage is one or two word sentences and whining... you're not sure you can even remember why you want to complain. as more of you is eaten, the more whatever the machine did to your head seems to take over. That's a relief to you but you're not sure why...

the lady in front of you is offering you something. it looks tasty.

"want some?" she asks, sweetly. you just grin and nod.

you were right it IS tasty. you hastily finish off the morsel, hugging her in thanks.

"More?"

"all gone."

"aw..."

The two of you seem to have decided on playing around like children is the best way to spend the next hour, near the end of which you both black out briefly only to wake up with headaches.

"Ugh... how in the-..." you grumble to yourself, confused on how you can even have a headache. slipping a hand up to the side of your head, and without meaning to under the lid. There's something squishy inside, and touching it males for all kinds of weird sensations... "Is that my... how..."

"You're not the first one to wonder what would happen if something happened to a removed brain. There's a safety system that grows a new brain from body fat if something happens to the old one." She explains, still sitting across from you, arms crossed. "Probably the first one who made it go off by the original getting eaten though."
123322211112.title: no just finish the procedure.

choices: Go to the address that evening
1233222111122.content:
"So, I guess you're probably pretty mad..." you comment sheepishly, looking anywhere but at her. Not really having any good excuse for what you did.

"About you misplacing my clothes, yes." She states, hesitating a moment before adding, "The rest... Well... Not being able to think was actually really relaxing... and i was due for a break..."

You're honestly not sure what to think, or say about that, though after about a minute you notice you're getting light headed. She's apparently noticed it too, and is walking towards you, holding your jar with one arm, and keeping the other across her chest.

Setting the jar down, she hinges your head open and lifts your brain out, dropping it into the jar immediately followed by her own. right away everything snaps back into focus, and she comments, "Tell you what, if you can get me my jar and uniform back, before anyone notices I'm not at the reception desk, I'll keep an eye on this for you while you're gone."

nodding as she scoops up the jar, you head back out to grab her things as well as stuffing her jar into your backpack, then return. She's able to get back into her work clothes, and the two of you make it back to the front desk just in time for her to get stuck dealing with another customer. There's no time to switch jars back, so she stashes the one with both brains back in the spot where she had kept hers, and scribbles a note on your receipt.

you can come get it from me after work.
31 pine terrace Apt D
1233222111122.title: She forgives you, it seems she enjoyed her time...

choices: Just put it in the jar.
12332221111221.content:
Later that evening, you're at the address mentioned, It wasn't actually that far a trip, it turns out the two of you live in the same building, with yours being one of the two in the basement. they're not as spacious because of the utility room, and the the windows are barely there, but hey, cheaper rent is cheaper rent.

with a little hesitation, you knock on the door to the apartment. eliciting a confused "Hello?" as the receptionist from the clinic can be heard walking toards the door. When she opens it, her confusion turns to surprise as she recognizes you "But, I didn't use the buzzer, how did you-"

She goes silent as you hold up your own key chain, the same front door and mail room keys she has hanging right next to the one for your truck, etched with a letter 'F'.

"Oh you're kidding me."

"Nope." you can't help a bit of playful smugness creeping into your tone, having already had a few hours to get over that particular surprise.

Rolling her eyes, she offers, "Come on in, The jar is on the counter in the kitchen." opening the door the rest of the way

Heading inside, you spot your jar pretty quickly, setting down the one of hers you'd been carrying next to it. twisting the lid off you reach in and pick out one of the brains. At first you wonder how you're going to tell which is which before a familiar lightheaded feeling starts to creep into you.

Oh, right.

Putting your brain back in the jar, you reach for the other one and lift it out. Now that you're holding your neighbor's brain again though, that temptation to do something to it is back.

...and you did have all afternoon to look up ideas online. There were some pretty neat ones.

"Okay, what are you up to?" she asks, having followed you into the room after shutting the door.

should you do something to her brain?
12332221111221.title: Go to the address that evening

choices: put her back in her jar.
dont. you already know she'll just grow a new one if this one gets too messed up
123322211112211.content:
With a friendly smile, you answer, "Just this." as you press your thumbs into two specific spots on her brain. Immediately she grabs hold of the door frame to keep from falling, as her muscles aren't completely under her own control all of a sudden.

Before she can say anything you comment, "You need to relax." and start moving your thumbs around slightly, adjusting where you're putting pressure. As you're doing this different groups of her muscles are contracting and relaxing in time to your motions, as if her entire body were giving itself a massage.

"Do you want me to keep going?" you ask, already knowing how she'll answer. Rather than say anything she just nods, any trace of concern or alarm in her expression having long since been replaced by a relaxed smile.

By the time you're done with her brain she's 'gone dumb' from being out of her jar too long again. her brain looking quite dry.
123322211112211.title: Do It.

choices: have fun with her while she's brainless.
1233222111122112.content:
Deciding to keep going, you walk over to her fridge and pop the brain into the freezer. turning to her, you ask, "Do you want a special treat?"

She answers with a nod, looking a tad uncoordinated.

"Alright, can you wait here till I get back?"

Again she nods, her head bobbing hard enough to make the clip on her skull pop open and her head start flapping open and closed noisily. It's really hard not to laugh at how silly that looks.

Grabbing you jar and hading back to your apartment, you take a few minutes to stash you brain in a safe spot before digging a bottle of rum and a bag of frozen pineapple out of your own fridge. Locking up and heading back up to... huh... did you ever ask her name? whoops. ...up to her apartment, You find her obediently waiting where you left her.

You dump some of the pineapple into a blender, followed by some of the rum, and finally followed by retrieving her partly chilled brain from the freezer, and adding that to the blender. After a minute of running the machine and a quick search for glasses, the two of you are sitting on her couch enjoying pineapple and brain smoothies, which she really seems to like.
1233222111122112.title: She'll be fine...

choices: She let's it go, and just goes back to following your orders.
She starts to unscew your jar, licking her lips the entire time.
12332221112.content:
You decide that you're tired of the headache that comes with haing a body, and that you would much rather be just a brain in a jar. Having made up your mind, you select the second option. A mask drops down over your mouth, and everything suddenly goes fuzzy...

When you wake up you suddenly feel much smaller. You look around, and catch sight of yourself in one of the pods mirrored walls.

Your jar is filled with a blowing fluid, and you can see the back of your brain. On top, is a camera, a microphone, and some speakers, all of which have rotated backwards. Rotating your sensors again, you see your brainless body slumped over. Suddenly, you hear a noise, and rotate back to face the entrance of the pod.

It looks like your brain deprived friend has gotten curious. She reaches down and picks you up. "Oooh! More snackies!" She looks at you hungrily and licks her lips.

"Now wiat just a minute! I am NOT food!"

"H-huh? Who said dat?"

"I did! In the jar! I am not food!"

"You? But... You LOOK like food..."

"Well I'm not. Remember the person you told to go in here?" She nods. "That's me. I decided to discard my body."

"So... Food?"

"No! Not food!" Gah! It's like arguing with a two year old! Maybe you shouldn't have told her to eat her own brain.
12332221112.title: ...That you want to become just a brain in a ja...

choices: She begins to chow down on you.
123322211122.content:
To your terror, she begins to undo the lid of your jar. "Mmmm... More tasty, tasty thinky bits!" She lifts the lid away and reaches in to grab you.

"No wait! Sto-!" Your begging is cut off as she pulls you out, disconnecting you from your speaker. You can no longer hear or see either, since your camera and microphone were disconnected as well. Fearing the worst, you brace yourself for what is about to happen.
123322211122.title: She starts to unscew your jar, licking her lips...

choices: Your body lost its grip! The catgirl has you all to herself now!
Your body managed to keep it's grip! It's got at least part of you safe!
1233222111222.content:
You prepare yourself to be devoured. You certainly weren't planning on this, but you should have realized it would happen after how eager that cat was to have more brains to eat. At least you don't have any senses, so you won't hear, see, or feel a thing, but that's small comfort to you. But something seems to be wrong. You know you can't tell what's going on, but it seems like you should be dead by now. And yet you feel distinctly uneaten. What gives?

Although you have no way of knowing, it turns out that, whatever is letting the cat girl move around without a brain is effecting your body as well! Your body is up and about, and is currently arguing with the cat girl about who gets the brain. Actually, arguing is too sophisticated a term for what's happening. What they're actually doing is playing tug-o-war. With you as the rope.

"Come on! Gimme it!" Your body tugs you towards itself.

"No! I's hungry!" The cat girl pulls you back.

"But is mine!"

"Nuh-uh! Mine!"

"Is from mah head!"

"Is my snacky!"

This continues for a few minutes, with each of them pulling on your brain. If you could feel what's going on, you'd be surprised you hadn't already been torn in half by now. Eventually, something happens, and the bodies go flying apart!
1233222111222.title: But nothing seems to happen.

choices: "No fair! I wan'ed th' thinky bit!" She stomps her foot and throws a tantrum.
"Oh yeah? Well I got some too, so there!" She holds up half of your brain.
12332221112222.content:
Suddenly, there's a sort of snapping sound, and the two brainless bodies suddenly go flying in opposite directions! The cat girl winds up sprawled on the floor, while your body slams against the opposite wall. The cat girl stirs first, getting shakily to her feet. "H-huh? Wha happen?"

Your body holds up it's prize in triumph. "I got th' thinky bit! I got th' thinky bit!" It does a little victory dance while waving around your lump of grey-matter. The cat girl glares at it.
12332221112222.title: Your body managed to keep it's grip! It'...

choices: You body starts to eat you!
123322211122221.content:
Your body dopily grins at the cat girl, holding its prize high. Your brain slowly pulsates in your former hand which catches the attention of your body. Pulling your brain close it cocks it's head to the side with a puzzled look on its face. "Hey, loser! What this for?" Your mindless body clumsily asks the cat girl, still pouting in the corner. "It's my snack you big meanie, and you stole it." She huffs.

"Snack?" Your body says aloud before taking a long lick across your two hemispheres.
123322211122221.title: "No fair! I wan'ed th' thinky bit!&...

choices: “Why are the effects listed as permanent?”
124.content: What else could you ask the catgirl receptionist?

info.brief_description: A brain center has just opened up, where you can go to get brain transplants, removals,etc
info.description:
Welcome to the Brain Center! here are a few rules for this story

1: Brain transplants require complete removal of the brain, but does not require a second organic body. Get creative!

2: Brain transplants should crate story branches, as in staying with the body or moving on with the brain in the new body.

3: there is no limit to what you can do with a brain. For example, Increasing or Lowering I.Q. Is fair game!

That's all for now, please enjoy your stay!

(This story will obviiously only begin here, and revisit the center for additional swaps and such. Please feel free to continue on as to what you do after reciving the surgery!)
